docs.snippet: Vying for votes, Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton are each promising to do more to preserve American jobs at a time of slowing global economic growth....
docs.lead_paragraph: Vying for votes, Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton are each promising to do more to preserve American jobs at a time of slowing global economic growth.

headline.main: Heng on Presidential Candidates Targeting China

docs.snippet: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts....
docs.lead_paragraph: Advisers and allies say Mrs. Clinton would try to find common ground with Republicans on immigration and infrastructure spending, and appoint women to half of her cabinet posts.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton's plans for her first 100 days in office, should she be elected president, include quickly finding ground with Republican lawmakers, placing women in key positions of power and bringing back intimate negotiation style; it remains to be seen whether Republicans would be willing to negotiate, while some liberals have called for more aggressive pushback against Republican agenda.

headline.main: ‘President Hillary Clinton?’ She Wants Progress on Immigration and to Drink With G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: A Second President Clinton?  Mapping Out Her First 100 Days

docs.snippet: A great-grandson of the composer John Philip Sousa is working to keep Hillary Clinton from winning the presidency in November....
docs.lead_paragraph: A great-grandson of the composer John Philip Sousa is working to keep Hillary Clinton from winning the presidency in November.
docs.abstract: Grace Notes column; John Philip Sousa IV, great-grandson of man who composed patriotic march The Stars and Stripes Forever, is conservative activist who encouraged Ben Carson to run for president; has now turned his attention to defeating Hillary Clinton without explicitly endorsing Donald Trump.

headline.main: John Philip Sousa IV, With Help From a Famous Surname, Dabbles in Politics
headline.print_headline: Marching Behind a Presidential Candidate, With Help From a Famous Name

docs.snippet: Mr. Trump was criticized on Saturday for posting an image that contained a Star of David shape and called his opponent “the most corrupt candidate ever!”...

headline.main: Donald Trump Deletes Tweet Showing Hillary Clinton and Star of David Shape

docs.snippet: At a time when Donald J. Trump and the pro-“Brexit” crowd are preaching nativism and nationalism, the president undertakes the delicate task of arguing the opposite....
docs.lead_paragraph: At a time when Donald J. Trump and the pro-“Brexit” crowd are preaching nativism and nationalism, the president undertakes the delicate task of arguing the opposite.
docs.abstract: White House Letter; Pres Obama plans to argue importance of open, interconnected societies during trip to Europe, in effort to push back against nativism and nationalism preached by Donald Trump and Brexit supporters; countering anti-free-trade arguments in 2016 election year will require strength of Obama's oratorical skills.

headline.main: Obama Will Need His Oratory Powers to Sell Globalization

docs.snippet: Top lawmakers from both major U.S. political parties said on Sunday they trusted the Justice Department to appropriately handle its probe of presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's private email server, after a heavily criticized meeting between ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Top lawmakers from both major U.S. political parties said on Sunday they trusted the Justice Department to appropriately handle its probe of presidential candidate Hillary Clinton's private email server, after a heavily criticized meeting between Clinton's husband and the U.S. attorney general.

headline.main: Top Lawmakers Confident in Fairness of Clinton Email Probe
headline.print_headline: Top Lawmakers Confident in Fairness of Clinton Email Probe
